low_findings.title: Environment variable access for API keys
low_findings.description: The skill accesses DD_API_KEY environment variable for DataDog integration. While legitimate for monitoring, environment variables should be accessed securely and not logged. Quote from SKILL.md lines 528-532: 'curl -X POST "https://api.datadoghq.com/api/v1/series?api_key=${DD_API_KEY}"' - API keys in command lines could be exposed in process listings.

content.user_title: Verify Code Quality with Truth Scoring
content.value_statement: Manual code quality checks slow down development and miss critical issues. This skill provides automated truth scoring, verification checks, and automatic rollback to ensure every code change meets quality standards before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Real-time truth scoring on 0.0-1.0 scale for code and agent outputs
Automated verification checks for correctness, security, and best practices
Automatic rollback to last good state when verification fails
Statistical quality metrics with trends and confidence intervals
CI/CD pipeline integration with JSON/HTML/CSV export
Interactive dashboard with real-time WebSocket updates
limitations: Requires Claude Flow and Git repository installed
Cannot verify code in uncommitted Git working trees for rollback
External API integrations require additional configuration

use_cases.title: Quality Gates in CI/CD
use_cases.description: Add verification checks to GitHub Actions or GitLab CI pipelines to block low-quality merges.

use_cases.title: Agent Output Validation
use_cases.description: Score and verify AI-generated code before committing to ensure reliability.

use_cases.title: Automated Code Audits
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive verification on files or directories with auto-fix capabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Score Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run truth scoring on my codebase and show overall scores with any items below 0.85 threshold.

prompt_templates.title: Verify File
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify this file passes all quality checks with 0.95 threshold. Show detailed breakdown of any failures.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run batch verification on all TypeScript files in src/. Include security and performance checks.

prompt_templates.title: Rollback on Failure
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my changes. If verification fails, automatically rollback to the last good commit and explain what went wrong.

output_examples.input: Run truth scoring on my codebase

best_practices: Set appropriate thresholds per environment: 0.99 for production, 0.95 for staging, 0.90 for development
Enable auto-rollback to prevent low-quality code from persisting in the codebase
Integrate verification into CI/CD pipelines to block merges that fail quality checks
anti_patterns: Using default thresholds without considering project-specific quality requirements
Ignoring verification failures without reviewing the root cause
Running verification only at the end of development instead of continuously during development

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install via the skills directory for full functionality.

faq.question: What verification thresholds should I use?
faq.answer: Production code needs 0.99, staging 0.95, and development 0.90. Adjust based on project requirements.

faq.question: How does rollback work with uncommitted changes?
faq.answer: Rollback uses Git history. Uncommitted changes must be stashed or committed first. Use git status to check state.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services?
faq.answer: Metrics are exported only when you configure integrations. Code content stays local unless explicitly exported.

faq.question: Verification is timing out on large codebases
faq.command: Use batch verification with --batch-size option or increase timeout with --timeout 60s flag.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional testing?
faq.answer: This complements testing by scoring code quality, security, and best practices. Traditional tests verify behavior, this verifies quality.
